page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: General Area of Brent Knoll The area is domimated by Brent Knoll Which is about 470ft high. From the top it is possible to for long distances across the Bristle Channel on one side and across Somerset on the other.The land is mainly flat.It consists of low-lying grass land,which is crissed-crossed by rhynes(A rhyne is a narrow stream which drains into the sea).Approximately 2/3 of the area is used for dairy farming.There are two villages,East Brent and Brent Knoll,which was once Known as South Brent.Both villages lie at the foot of the Knoll on oppsite sides.Each village appears to have grown from its own church,both built on the lower slopes of the Knoll.A few farm houses lie on the outskirts of each village.
